verses.text: And Abraham was old , \add and\add* well stricken in age : and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had blessed Abraham in all things.\f + \fr 24.1 \ft well…: Heb. gone into days\f*
And Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house , that ruled over all that he had, Put , I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh :

And I will make thee swear by the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of heaven , and the God of the earth , that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites , among whom I dwell :
But thou shalt go unto my country , and to my kindred , and take a wife unto my son Isaac.
And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land : must I needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest ?
And Abraham said unto him, Beware thou that thou bring not my son thither again. \p

¶ The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of heaven , which took me from my father’s house , and from the land of my kindred , and which spake unto me, and that sware unto me, saying , Unto thy seed will I give this land ; he shall send his angel before thee , and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from thence.
And if the woman will not be willing to follow thee , then thou shalt be clear from this my oath : only bring not my son thither again.
And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master , and sware to him concerning that matter. \p

¶ And the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master , and departed ; for all the goods of his master \add were\add* in his hand : and he arose , and went to Mesopotamia , unto the city of Nahor.\f + \fr 24.10 \ft for: or, and\f*

And he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water at the time of the evening , \add even\add* the time that women go out to draw \add water\add*.\f + \fr 24.11 \ft that…: Heb. that women who draw water go forth\f*
And he said , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of my master Abraham , I pray thee, send me good speed this day , and shew kindness unto my master Abraham.
Behold, I stand \add here\add* by the well of water ; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water :

And let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say , Let down thy pitcher , I pray thee, that I may drink ; and she shall say , Drink , and I will give thy camels drink also: \add let the same be\add* she \add that\add* thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac ; and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master. \p

¶ And it came to pass, before he had done speaking , that, behold, Rebekah came out , who was born to Bethuel , son of Milcah , the wife of Nahor , Abraham’s brother , with her pitcher upon her shoulder.

And the damsel \add was\add* very fair to look upon , a virgin , neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well , and filled her pitcher , and came up.\f + \fr 24.16 \ft very…: Heb. good of countenance\f*
And the servant ran to meet her , and said , Let me, I pray thee, drink a little water of thy pitcher.
And she said , Drink , my lord : and she hasted , and let down her pitcher upon her hand , and gave him drink.
And when she had done giving him drink , she said , I will draw \add water\add* for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.
And she hasted , and emptied her pitcher into the trough , and ran again unto the well to draw \add water\add*, and drew for all his camels.
And the man wondering at her held his peace , to wit whether the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had made his journey prosperous or not.

And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking , that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight , and two bracelets for her hands of ten \add shekels\add* weight of gold ;\f + \fr 24.22 \ft earring: or, jewel for the forehead\f*
And said , Whose daughter \add art\add* thou ? tell me, I pray thee: is there room \add in\add* thy father’s house for us to lodge in ?
And she said unto him, I \add am\add* the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah , which she bare unto Nahor.
She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and provender enough , and room to lodge in.
And the man bowed down his head , and worshipped the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And he said , Blessed \add be\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of my master Abraham , who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth : I \add being\add* in the way , the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* led me to the house of my master’s brethren.
And the damsel ran , and told \add them of\add* her mother’s house these things. \p
¶ And Rebekah had a brother , and his name \add was\add* Laban : and Laban ran out unto the man , unto the well.

And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister’s hands , and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister , saying , Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man ; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.
And he said , Come in , thou blessed of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; wherefore standest thou without ? for I have prepared the house , and room for the camels. \p
¶ And the man came into the house : and he ungirded his camels , and gave straw and provender for the camels , and water to wash his feet , and the men’s feet that \add were\add* with him.
And there was set \add meat\add* before him to eat : but he said , I will not eat , until I have told mine errand. And he said , Speak on.
And he said , I \add am\add* Abraham’s servant.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath blessed my master greatly ; and he is become great : and he hath given him flocks , and herds , and silver , and gold , and menservants , and maidservants , and camels , and asses.
And Sarah my master’s wife bare a son to my master when she was old : and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
And my master made me swear , saying , Thou shalt not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the Canaanites , in whose land I dwell :
But thou shalt go unto my father’s house , and to my kindred , and take a wife unto my son.
And I said unto my master , Peradventure the woman will not follow me.

And he said unto me, The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, before whom I walk , will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way ; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred , and of my father’s house :
Then shalt thou be clear from \add this\add* my oath , when thou comest to my kindred ; and if they give not thee \add one\add*, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
And I came this day unto the well , and said , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of my master Abraham , if now thou do prosper my way which I go :

Behold, I stand by the well of water ; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw \add water\add*, and I say to her, Give me , I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink ;

And she say to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels : \add let\add* the same \add be\add* the woman whom the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath appointed out for my master’s son.

And before I had done speaking in mine heart , behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder ; and she went down unto the well , and drew \add water:\add* and I said unto her, Let me drink , I pray thee.
And she made haste , and let down her pitcher from her \add shoulder\add*, and said , Drink , and I will give thy camels drink also: so I drank , and she made the camels drink also.

And I asked her, and said , Whose daughter \add art\add* thou? And she said , The daughter of Bethuel , Nahor’s son , whom Milcah bare unto him: and I put the earring upon her face , and the bracelets upon her hands.

And I bowed down my head , and worshipped the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and blessed the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of my master Abraham , which had led me in the right way to take my master’s brother’s daughter unto his son.
And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master , tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand , or to the left.
Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said , The thing proceedeth from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
Behold, Rebekah \add is\add* before thee , take \add her\add*, and go , and let her be thy master’s son’s wife , as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath spoken.
And it came to pass, that, when Abraham’s servant heard their words , he worshipped the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add bowing himself\add* to the earth.

And the servant brought forth jewels of silver , and jewels of gold , and raiment , and gave \add them\add* to Rebekah : he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.\f + \fr 24.53 \ft jewels: Heb. vessels\f* \p
And they did eat and drink , he and the men that \add were\add* with him, and tarried all night ; and they rose up in the morning , and he said , Send me away unto my master.
And her brother and her mother said , Let the damsel abide with us \add a few\add* days , at the least ten ; after that she shall go.\f + \fr 24.55 \ft a few…: or, a full year, or ten months\f*
And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath prospered my way ; send me away that I may go to my master.
And they said , We will call the damsel , and enquire at her mouth.
And they called Rebekah , and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man ? And she said , I will go.
And they sent away Rebekah their sister , and her nurse , and Abraham’s servant , and his men.
And they blessed Rebekah , and said unto her, Thou \add art\add* our sister , be thou \add the mother\add* of thousands of millions , and let thy seed possess the gate of those which hate them. \p
¶ And Rebekah arose , and her damsels , and they rode upon the camels , and followed the man : and the servant took Rebekah , and went his way. \p
And Isaac came from the way of the well Lahai-roi ; for he dwelt in the south country.
And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide : and he lifted up his eyes , and saw , and, behold, the camels \add were\add* coming.\f + \fr 24.63 \ft to meditate: or, to pray\f*
And Rebekah lifted up her eyes , and when she saw Isaac , she lighted off the camel.

For she \add had\add* said unto the servant , What man \add is\add* this that walketh in the field to meet us ? And the servant \add had\add* said , It \add is\add* my master : therefore she took a vail , and covered herself.
And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.
And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah’s tent , and took Rebekah , and she became his wife ; and he loved her: and Isaac was comforted after his mother’s \add death\add*.
